diff --git a/.project-roadmap/issues-db/upstream/1066.json b/.project-roadmap/issues-db/upstream/1066.json
index 20b8a7d8a..262fe1019 100644
--- a/.project-roadmap/issues-db/upstream/1066.json
+++ b/.project-roadmap/issues-db/upstream/1066.json
@@ -10,12 +10,19 @@
   "created_at": "2018-08-06T11:54:30Z",
   "github_updated_at": "2018-08-09T04:03:04Z",
   "body_snippet": "Sometimes I use the mRemoteNG to demonstrate things and the problem I'm facing is that the font is too small and nearly impossible to read on TV screens or projectors.\r\n\r\nI tried the Windows Magnifying glass, but it's not very convenient and the screen sharing app we use (coincidentally called \"Zoom\") doesn't support that.\r\n\r\nIt would be very useful to have a zoom feature like in IDEs and browsers: Zoom In/Out by Ctrl+ / Ctrl- (or Ctrl + Scroll). It's implemented simply by changing font size. Or...",
-  "our_status": "new",
-  "priority": null,
+  "our_status": "triaged",
+  "priority": "P3-enhancement",
   "target_release": null,
   "our_branch": null,
   "our_pr": null,
-  "iterations": [],
+  "iterations": [
+    {
+      "seq": 1,
+      "date": "2026-02-17",
+      "type": "triaged",
+      "description": "Useful presentation feature for SSH/console connections - zoom via Ctrl+/- to increase terminal font size during demos"
+    }
+  ],
   "comments": [
     {
       "id": "MDEyOklzc3VlQ29tbWVudDQxMDcwNTM0MA==",
@@ -59,5 +66,5 @@
   "needs_action": true,
   "waiting_for_us": true,
   "last_synced": "2026-02-15T09:52:50Z",
-  "notes": ""
+  "notes": "AI triage (claude): Useful presentation feature for SSH/console connections - zoom via Ctrl+/- to increase terminal font size during demos\nApproach: Add Ctrl+/- keyboard handler on connection tabs that sends font-size change to embedded PuTTY window via WM_SETFONT or PuTTY config reload; scope to SSH/Telnet console protocols only, not RDP"
 }
diff --git a/.project-roadmap/issues-db/upstream/1069.json b/.project-roadmap/issues-db/upstream/1069.json
index 5256ca9ae..697efa149 100644
--- a/.project-roadmap/issues-db/upstream/1069.json
+++ b/.project-roadmap/issues-db/upstream/1069.json
@@ -11,12 +11,19 @@
   "created_at": "2018-08-10T08:42:34Z",
   "github_updated_at": "2019-09-14T09:41:34Z",
   "body_snippet": "Feature Request to be able to send the Windows Key via the Send Special Keys menu option.\r\n\r\nI'm using RDP and the menu is located when right clicking on the connected server tab. The menu item is called \"Send Special Keys (RDP)\".\r\nAt present the options are Ctrl-Alt-Del and Ctrl-Esc.\r\nIs it possible to be able to add an extra item for sending the Windows Key?\r\n\r\nThis will be useful as the Server I'm using has a hidden taskbar. Its tricky to get to the taskbar in a RDP environment when hidden.\r\n...",
-  "our_status": "new",
-  "priority": null,
+  "our_status": "triaged",
+  "priority": "P3-enhancement",
   "target_release": null,
   "our_branch": null,
   "our_pr": null,
-  "iterations": [],
+  "iterations": [
+    {
+      "seq": 1,
+      "date": "2026-02-17",
+      "type": "triaged",
+      "description": "Add Windows Key option to VNC Send Special Keys menu using X11 keysym injection (XK_Super_L)."
+    }
+  ],
   "comments": [
     {
       "id": "MDEyOklzc3VlQ29tbWVudDQxMjEyMDQ1Mg==",
@@ -60,5 +67,5 @@
   "needs_action": true,
   "waiting_for_us": true,
   "last_synced": "2026-02-15T09:52:50Z",
-  "notes": ""
+  "notes": "AI triage (gemini): Add Windows Key option to VNC Send Special Keys menu using X11 keysym injection (XK_Super_L).\nApproach: Add `WindowsKey` to `SpecialKeys` enum. In `SendSpecialKeys`, use reflection to invoke `WriteKeyboardEvent` on the underlying `VncClient` with `XK_Super_L` keysym (simulating press and release). Update UI to include the new menu option."
 }

diff --git a/mRemoteNG/Connection/Protocol/VNC/Connection.Protocol.VNC.cs b/mRemoteNG/Connection/Protocol/VNC/Connection.Protocol.VNC.cs
index 7444bf166..2cbb03d8f 100644
--- a/mRemoteNG/Connection/Protocol/VNC/Connection.Protocol.VNC.cs
+++ b/mRemoteNG/Connection/Protocol/VNC/Connection.Protocol.VNC.cs
@@ -222,6 +222,9 @@ namespace mRemoteNG.Connection.Protocol.VNC
                     case SpecialKeys.CtrlEsc:
                         _vnc.SendSpecialKeys(VncSharpCore.SpecialKeys.CtrlEsc);
                         break;
+                    case SpecialKeys.WindowsKey:
+                        SendWindowsKey();
+                        break;
                 }
             }
             catch (Exception ex)
@@ -232,6 +235,38 @@ namespace mRemoteNG.Connection.Protocol.VNC
             }
         }
 
+        private void SendWindowsKey()
+        {
+            if (_vnc == null) return;
+
+            // X11 keysym for Left Super (Windows) key
+            const uint XK_Super_L = 0xFFEB;
+
+            try
+            {
+                // Use reflection to access the internal VncClient and its WriteKeyboardEvent method
+                var vncField = typeof(VncSharpCore.RemoteDesktop)
+                    .GetField("vnc", BindingFlags.NonPublic | BindingFlags.Instance);
+
+                var vncClient = vncField?.GetValue(_vnc);
+                if (vncClient == null) return;
+
+                var writeKeyboardEvent = vncClient.GetType()
+                    .GetMethod("WriteKeyboardEvent", BindingFlags.Public | BindingFlags.Instance);
+
+                if (writeKeyboardEvent == null) return;
+
+                // Send KeyDown
+                writeKeyboardEvent.Invoke(vncClient, new object[] { XK_Super_L, true });
+                // Send KeyUp
+                writeKeyboardEvent.Invoke(vncClient, new object[] { XK_Super_L, false });
+            }
+            catch (Exception ex)
+            {
+                 Runtime.MessageCollector.AddExceptionMessage("SendWindowsKey (Connection.Protocol.VNC) failed", ex);
+            }
+        }
+
         public void StartChat()
         {
             Runtime.MessageCollector.AddMessage(Messages.MessageClass.InformationMsg,
@@ -416,7 +451,8 @@ namespace mRemoteNG.Connection.Protocol.VNC
         public enum SpecialKeys
         {
             CtrlAltDel,
-            CtrlEsc
+            CtrlEsc,
+            WindowsKey
         }
 
         public enum Compression

                     case SpecialKeys.CtrlEsc:
                         _vnc.SendSpecialKeys(VncSharpCore.SpecialKeys.CtrlEsc);
                         break;

                 }

             }
         }
 
+        private void SendWindowsKey()
+        {
+            if (_vnc == null) return;
+
+            // X11 keysym for Left Super (Windows) key
+            const uint XK_Super_L = 0xFFEB;
+
+            try
+            {
+                // Use reflection to access the internal VncClient and its WriteKeyboardEvent method
+                var vncField = typeof(VncSharpCore.RemoteDesktop)
+                    .GetField("vnc", BindingFlags.NonPublic | BindingFlags.Instance);
+
+                var vncClient = vncField?.GetValue(_vnc);
+                if (vncClient == null) return;
+
+                var writeKeyboardEvent = vncClient.GetType()
+                    .GetMethod("WriteKeyboardEvent", BindingFlags.Public | BindingFlags.Instance);
+
+                if (writeKeyboardEvent == null) return;
+
+                // Send KeyDown
+                writeKeyboardEvent.Invoke(vncClient, new object[] { XK_Super_L, true });
+                // Send KeyUp
